names.pinyin: shao yao gan cao fu zi tang

actions: Nourishes the Blood, astringes Yin, adjusts the Ying and Wei, softens the Liver and relieves pain.
With Gan Cao, for abdominal pain due to disharmony between the Liver and Stomach and epigastric, hypochondriac or flank pain.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates spasms, alleviates pain and moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs.
Warms Ming Men Fire, assists Heart, Kidney and Spleen Yang, disperses Cold and Dampness, warms the channels and stops pain.

syndromes: Acute cramping due to Yang Deficiency
Shang Han Tai Yang which shows Yang Deficiency symptoms after diaphoresis
notes: This condition can be brought on by using the diaphoretic method on patients with sores.
